summary: This document is an email chain from August 9-10, 2019, between attorney Bruce Barket and an Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It discusses the conclusion of an investigation into a suicide attempt by Jeffrey Epstein, with the attorney requesting that a staff attorney not be interviewed without his permission. The emails also reference the institution being locked down due to an incident in the press.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing a client (likely Jeffrey Epstein) at MCC New York. He inquires about an investigation into Epstein's suicide attempt and requests that a staff attorney not be interviewed without his permission.

persons.name: Nick
persons.context: A Supervisory Staff Attorney at the MCC New York's Central Legal Center. Bruce Barket specifically requests that investigators not interview him about the Epstein investigation without Barket's permission.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation referenced in the emails. The investigation concerned a suicide attempt by Epstein while incarcerated at MCC New York.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is acting as legal counsel, inquiring about an investigation into Epstein's suicide attempt and seeking to control access to potential witnesses.
Barket asserts control over investigators' access to Nick, the Supervisory Staff Attorney, indicating a protective legal relationship concerning the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Conclusion of Epstein Suicide Attempt Investigation
events.description: An email states that the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt has concluded and no charges or disciplinary actions are being filed.

events.title: MCC New York Lockdown
events.description: The Metropolitan Correctional Center is reported to be locked down due to an incident that is 'all over the press at the moment.' This coincides with the period just before Epstein's death.

events.title: Attorney Request to Bar Interview
events.description: Attorney Bruce Barket sends an email requesting that investigators not interview Supervisory Staff Attorney 'Nick' about the Epstein investigation without Barket's permission.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco, 666 Old Country Road, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: An investigation into a suicide attempt by Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York was concluded with no charges or disciplinary actions filed, as of August 9, 2019.
Attorney Bruce Barket sought to prevent investigators from interviewing a supervisory staff attorney (Nick) at the prison without his explicit permission.
The MCC New York was under lockdown on August 10, 2019, due to a press-covered incident, which contextualizes the security environment just prior to Epstein's death.
The correspondence shows active legal maneuvering and communication between Epstein's defense and prison officials in the days immediately preceding Epstein's death.
